To solve the problem \(3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3(1+3)))))))))\), we start by computing each layer from the innermost parentheses outward.

1. Compute the innermost layer:
   \[
   1 + 3 = 4
   \]

2. Compute each subsequent layer:
   \[
   \begin{align*}
   \text{Layer 2} & : 1 + 3 \times 4 = 1 + 12 = 13, \\
   \text{Layer 3} & : 1 + 3 \times 13 = 1 + 39 = 40, \\
   \text{Layer 4} & : 1 + 3 \times 40 = 1 + 120 = 121, \\
   \text{Layer 5} & : 1 + 3 \times 121 = 1 + 363 = 364, \\
   \text{Layer 6} & : 1 + 3 \times 364 = 1 + 1092 = 1093, \\
   \text{Layer 7} & : 1 + 3 \times 1093 = 1 + 3279 = 3280, \\
   \text{Layer 8} & : 1 + 3 \times 3280 = 1 + 9840 = 9841, \\
   \text{Layer 9} & : 1 + 3 \times 9841 = 1 + 29523 = 29524.
   \end{align*}
   \]

3. Multiply the result of the outermost layer by 3:
   \[
   3 \times 29524 = 88572
   \]

Thus, the final answer is \(\boxed{88572}\).
